timeline.bodyText:
I suggest some changes here:

If result is undefined, then val will be true and the test will pass, getting a false negative.
value.equals(null) never will be true, because in that case you will get a NPE.
Boolean val, you can use a primitive and avoid auto-boxing/unboxing.

timeline.bodyText: You still need to rollback the changes done on setup() to clean up the configuration. Notice the same server configuration file is re-used by other tests. You should ensure the configuration backs to its initial state when the test finish, even if the test assertion fails.
timeline.author: yersan

replies.bodyText: I think deployment, undeployment and clean up is done by arquillian.
replies.author: parsharma

replies.bodyText: @parsharma The configuration done in @Test method won't be clean up by Arquillian. The deployment archive with @Deployment will be undeployed by Arquillian. So it should be cleaned. It can be done either by cleaning it within your @Test method, or you can use SnapshotRestoreSetupTask for the configuration, you can refer to TracerEnableTestCase#TracerEnableSetup on the 2nd option.
replies.author: gaol

replies.bodyText: @gaol yes, yesterday I discussed with @yersan, he also suggested same by rolling back changes in the @test method itself. I referred to the same class you have suggested RarInsideEarReDeploymentTestCase. They are also removing address in finally, incase test class fails it will rollback all the changes.
